RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 40. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $15,000). (If necessary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JULES RULES pressured the pace dueling along the inside through the turn wresting the lead in upper stretch widening from the rail late. PORTIA'S HOPE pressured the pace carrying a short lead abreast rival through the turn ceding to foe in upper stretch proving second best late. LAURA'S GRAND tracked evenly racing inside to upper stretch proving no match for the pair while holding the others safe. ISLE BE THERE raced evenly throughout lacking more. FRIENDLY LUCY faded on the turn. TAPTAP was never involved. TRACE ESTATE was always outrun. OK EMILY folded up on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Friendly Lucy
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Laura's Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked evenly, inisde lane, held best of others

ENTRY.NAME: Trace Estate
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Jules Rules
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled inside to lane, edged away late rail

ENTRY.NAME: Portia's Hope
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled abreast to lane, ceded lead, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Taptap
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Ok Emily
ENTRY.COMMENT: folded up on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Isle Be There
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lacked more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 4 1/2F Turf CR: 75. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE ON THE TURF. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 24 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Tr ack.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRADARI pressed a narrow lead under outside through the turn then down the stretch digging deep to prevail. BOUJEE KITTEN slow early saved ground to upper stretch surging gamely late along the rail. WARRIOR EMPRESS stalked the pace through the turn chasing down the lane lacking needed late surge. TREASURED NIKKY pressured the pace dueling abreast rival through the turn then down the stretch weakening late. MIRACLE DRUG (IRE) bobbled leaving the gate, lagging after raced inside to upper stretch showing some late interest. VIVE EL MOMENTO raced evenly moving from mid track down the lane. SILVER STICK STAIR played no factor. ABUNDANT STORY was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Stradari
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed narrow lead, extended inside of foe, dug deep

ENTRY.NAME: Miracle Drug (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled at the break, rail lane

ENTRY.NAME: Abundant Story
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Boujee Kitten
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground to lane, rallied late on rail

ENTRY.NAME: Warrior Empress
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased lane, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Treasured Nikky
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled abreast lane, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Stick Stair
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Vive El Momento
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, mid track lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 76. Claiming Purse 11300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 24 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If nec essary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOOL FOR THE CITY set the pace holding daylight through the far turn being challenged from the inside in upper stretch extending late to prevail. CHASING A PAYDAY saved ground rallying to threaten foe from the inside in upper stretch staying on to the end. ANGELUS DIAMOND hustled along weakened on the far turn fading in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Fool for the City
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, held daylight through far turn, challenged, extended

ENTRY.NAME: Angelus Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, weakened far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Chasing a Payday
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, rallied to bid upper stretch, stayed on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 24 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: G MONEY LIV rushed clear set the pace through the turn being engaged from the inside in upper stretch responding from mid track to clear again late. SWEET TOOTSIE LU stalked the pace vying in the three path down the lane finishing well to salvage place. GOLD PASS a step slow through the turn rallied in upper stretch vying between horses in the two path ;late. OFFTHEROADAGAIN stalked the pace cutting the corner to challenge from the rail in upper stretch coming up a bit short late. MILLIE was always outrun. BET THE QUEEN was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Bet the Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Millie
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: G Money Liv
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed clear, set pace, hooked from inside lane, responded

ENTRY.NAME: Offtheroadagain
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, cut corner bidding from the rail lane, bit short

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Pass
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, rallied lane, vied late between horses

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Tootsie Lu
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, vied three path, finished well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 8100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 24 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHATA GUY sent clear set the pace on a solid lead through the far turn digging in down the lane holding between horses late. TODAY MATTERS stalked the pace chasing to upper stretch angling to the rail there closing in with a strong finiah. BLUE SKY PAINTER raced evenly through the far turn rallying in upper stretch vying willingly late in the three path. BECKHAM JAMES raced evenly off the pace fading to upper stretch. VOLTE FACE raced mid pack tiring in upper stretch. BLUEBANK struggled far back.

ENTRY.NAME: Today Matters
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased tolane, willingly late, closed gap inside

ENTRY.NAME: Whata Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, dug in lane, held between late driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Sky Painter
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, rallied into lane, vied willingly late three path

ENTRY.NAME: Bluebank
ENTRY.COMMENT: struggled far back

ENTRY.NAME: Beckham James
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, faded to lane

ENTRY.NAME: Volte Face
ENTRY.OWNER: Bernardini Jay P and Carlino David
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, tired lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 24, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 24 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eli gibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LEADING INDICATOR stalked the pace through the turn looming outside of rivals in the four path upper stretch surging late abreast foes arriving in time. CAPTAIN ANNE stalked the pace pressing in bid at the quarter pole taking a short lead in upper stretch dueling late missing to outside pressure. ISLAND WINTER set the pace being hooked at the quarter pole ceding in upper stretch battling back late from the rail. RORAIMA chased the pace angling out in mid stretch vying willingly in the final yards. CYBERBURG faded on the turn. LIGHT HEARTED retreated on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Light Hearted
ENTRY.COMMENT: retreated on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Island Winter
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, hooked 1/4 pole, dug in at rail, battled back

ENTRY.NAME: Cyberburg
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Roraima
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, angled out mid stretch, vied willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Anne
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, pressed 1/4 pole, led lane, grabbed late

ENTRY.NAME: Leading Indicator
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4 wide into lane, surged late, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 100. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 23800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $17,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 24 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500 (Claiming Races For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OBIWAN set the pace measuring on lead through the turn digging in from the four path down the lane holding firm to wire. THRU THE VINE stalked the pace chasing through the far turn into upper stretch extending there at mid track proving second best. DYRDEK in close at the break lagged early rallying along the inside into upper stretch giving an even finish. MARTIN MAN chased the early pace weakening on the far turn fading in upper stretch. HOBE SOUND dropped back early.

ENTRY.NAME: Obiwan
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, measured on lead, dug in four path lane, held firm

ENTRY.NAME: Thru the Vine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased to lane, vied mid track, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Dyrdek
ENTRY.COMMENT: in close start, lagged early, inside move to lane, even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Martin Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, weakened far turn, faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Hobe Sound
ENTRY.OWNER: Baird, John W. and Harbison, Rex
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back early

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 24, 2023. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CATES SWOOSH stalked the pace rallying to lead at the quarter pole drawing clear from mid track down the lane. BOLD PROPHET slow early saved ground to upper stretch rallying from the rail to save place. UNION BROTHER chased the pace racing four wide down the lane finishing evenly. SAVAGE NATION pressured the pace dueling through the turn weakening in the two path down the lane. THE FILTER chased early then faded to upper stretch. HIDING THE BRICK pressed early wavering on the turn giving way to upper stretch. CEDUNA was always outrun. PER RULING #254 FROM THE WEST VIRGINIA RACING COMMISSION, CATES SWOOSH WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM 1st TO UNPLACED DUE TO A POSITIVE TEST.

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Prophet
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground, rallied inside saving place

ENTRY.NAME: The Filter
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased early, faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Hiding the Brick
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early, tired,

ENTRY.NAME: Union Brother
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased the pace, 4 wide lane, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Cates Swoosh
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rallied to lead 1/4 pole, drew clear mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Savage Nation
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled turn, weakened inside lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ceduna
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,
